reviews.review: Cute game and relaxing in short bursts.. Be prepared for endless books

"Unpacking" is a relaxing little game with a cute story where you unpack items and put them away. 

There is a puzzle element where items have to go in certain places, and sometimes this felt too arbitrary (like does it really matter if the colander is in a drawer compared to a cabinet?), but besides a few of those frustrating moments it really is a cute game. I enjoyed playing to wind down after a long day, and it was fun to see what items the protagonist would carry over to their new home and see what was or wasn't important to them throughout each move. Truly, it's a cute story and a great way to show the character's personality and thoughts.

However, it is short, and it's easy to complete the game in one sitting - it took me a little over three hours to 100% the game. There's not too much replayability - you have three save slots in case you want to start all over again, and you can go back into previous levels and rearrange things, but that's about it. I think I would have liked either a few extra levels, or different items in replays, or a sandbox mode that lets you do whatever you want to justify the $20 price tag.

Overall, it's a fun little game I would recommend picking up....but wait for it to be on sale. As it stands, $20 is a bit steep for the amount of content you get, and while it is really good quality content, it's a bit steep.
特别治愈温暖的一个游戏，透过物品来推测她的生活，我好像真的陪同她度过了很久很久，经历了一遍她的人生，也在她的身上看到了我自己
Really short game, not worth 19.99 eur for only 4 hours of gameplay. Really cozy otherwise but not worth the money do not recommend.

Прекрасная расслаблялка, в котоой нужно расставить предметы после переезда по своим местам. Очень прикольно что это не просто рандомный набор предметов, а вещи можно сказать - с историей. Принадлежащие конкретному человеку. Вот наша первая детская комната. Вот первая арендованная квартира с чужими вещами, вот следующая, своя, полностью пустая. По набору "хлама" видно как идет жизнь. Что, например, мы с кем-то съехались. А вот и завели собственных детей. Немножко грустно когда с каждым переездом вещей из самого детства становится все меньше и меньше. На игрушках появляются заплатки.

Реализовано все очень качественно. Поставить что угодно можно почти куда угодно. Разве что на фоне такой свободы, редкие места где что-то разместить все же нельзя - слегка раздражают. Ну и плюс встречаются вещи, которые сразу не разберешь что вообще из себя представляют и где им место. В конце уровня, когда указывают на то, что вообще не на своем месте (совсем нелогичное было пару раз) - начинаешь тупо перебирать. Но это мелочи. Если другие выискивать - непонятно к чему в коробке для условной кухни, могут быть например носки. Т.е. к чему это понятно, реализм. Но немножко с полного чилаута такое сбивает.

Не понравилась - музыка. Уж точно то что звучит - не идеальное сопровождение для игрового процесса и атмосферы. И хотелось бы иметь возможность зумировать картинку. Или иметь промежуточный вариант между теми что предлагаются.

В остальном - прекрасное развлечение.

Unpacking is one of those games that feels like a warm hug without saying a single word. On the surface, you’re just opening boxes and placing objects in a home. But as you go through each stage — childhood bedrooms, student dorms, shared apartments, independent living — you start piecing together someone’s entire life through the little things they own. It’s quiet, simple, and incredibly emotional.

Gameplay
The mechanics couldn’t be more straightforward: you unpack boxes and figure out where everything should go. Each level represents a different stage of life, and by putting items in their right (or sometimes not-so-right) places, you slowly build a story. No timers, no competition, just the gentle puzzle of arranging a life. It’s peaceful, almost meditative, but also surprisingly deep.

Look and sound
The pixel art is soft and cozy, but the real magic is in the sound design. Every single object has its own unique sound effect when you pick it up or put it down — cups clink differently from plates, clothes fold softly, keyboards clatter just right. These tiny details make the whole experience tactile and personal. It’s like you can feel the objects through the audio.

Storytelling and themes
There’s no dialogue, barely any text. The story is told entirely through objects: a poster taped to the wall, a beloved plush toy, medicine bottles, photo frames. The game is all about identity, growth, heartbreak, joy — how our belongings carry who we are. Some moments hit hard, others feel comforting, but all of them are quietly powerful.

Accessibility and flow
It’s short — just a few hours — but that’s part of its charm. It’s replayable if you want to rearrange things or just revisit certain life stages. And it’s very accessible: simple controls, relaxed pacing, almost no language barriers. It really feels designed for anyone to step in and feel something.

Final thoughts
Unpacking is tender, melancholic, and strangely healing. It turns a mundane chore into art, and it leaves you reflecting on your own life, your own rooms, your own boxes. It’s not flashy, it’s not dramatic, but it’s one of those experiences that stay with you. Honestly, it’s comfort in pixels — the kind of game you’ll want to revisit when you just need a little bit of warmth.

Unpacking is such a soothing and relaxing experience. There’s something incredibly satisfying about the little sounds each item makes when you place it down, and there’s this sense of accomplishment when you finally see everything neatly in its place.

After all these years, this is still my favorite video game of all time. I've played through it 8 times (including a dark star run and a run with my boyfriend choosing where most things went over call) and I still will never get enough.
The art is beautiful, the little sounds everything makes is so satisfying, everything is so darn cute that I'm getting attached to the little travel trinkets. This is the sole video game soundtrack I'll listen to while doing work (or even doing some unpacking of my own). "Unpacking A Life" has been on my playlists for years, it's gorgeous. And I didn't even mention the story. Ough, I want to eat, sleep, and breathe this story. I've also purchased the fruit coasters, the kitty plush, and the space girl poster. I love how basically all the merch is actual items in the game, that's literally my favorite genre of merch.
I felt compelled to write a review after seeing so many criticizing the game for being "too short", "overpriced", and "picky". These are all untrue. Every run for me takes about 4-5 hours, and as I've said I've done 8 runs since the game launched. I always want to return to it for just a weekend comfort. 20$ is the perfect price for all the amazing work that's gone into it. And all the people complaining about items not being able to be placed in certain places really pisses me off. 1. It's a puzzle game. There's going to be correct spaces, it's not that hard to correct yourself. And 2. You can literally turn off the puzzle mechanic if you really want to just put things anywhere.
All that is to say, this is the best game of all time and I will play it until I die, (Hopefully surrounded by chick plushies)

[h1]9.0/10.0，小而精的游戏，几乎没有什么难度，适合强迫症玩[/h1]
好友推荐的游戏，游玩之后感觉体验确实不错。不过原价入手的话可能有点略贵（我通关+补成就的时长在两个小时左右，多出的时长是挂着掉卡），史低35入手的话就比较划算了。推荐在周末或者假期有完整时间的日子来享受这款游戏。

游戏的画面非常精美，即便我游玩过了如此多的像素游戏也依旧被游戏的画面惊艳到，每个物件单看都感觉是非常好的像素画临摹对象。

剧情方面，游戏中除了片尾cg没有出现任何角色，因此也没有人物对白出现，每关完成时会有简短的旁白。
不过即便没有多少文字出现在游戏里，我们依旧能从家具中一点点拼凑出主角的人设：她应该是一个喜欢运动、阅读、弹吉他[spoiler]还是贝斯来着[/spoiler]、玩游戏、养绿植，有一点生活小格调，专业是美术相关还拿过奖的女孩。
游戏剧情衔接非常自然，我们就像主角的这只小猪玩偶一样，陪着她从“开心终于有自己房间”的小女孩逐渐成长为能独当一面的成熟人士。

忘记在第几关了，主角跟男友同居之后，家里的装潢档次一下子上去了，不过整体风格变成了冷色调[spoiler]这种装潢风格适合独居，同居的话太没有生活气息了，除非两个人都很喜欢这种风格，不然建议是避开这种风格[/spoiler]，主角在家里的个人空间也一下子所剩无几，她的很多东西都只能收进柜子里。
而对她来说有着一定重要性的奖状，我几乎找不到可以挂的地方，为了通关只能放在床底了。[spoiler]相信不止我一个人通关之后又把奖状拿出来贴浴室上了[/spoiler]
莫名其妙想到朋友前几天和我说的：“现在同龄朋友结婚，虽然我祝福，但是很难真心觉得结婚这件事是幸福的。”对普通人来说，很难预知步入一段关系之后同居是得到的更多还是失去的更多。只不过住过校的朋友们都知道，个人的自由是一定会在集体住宿中被牺牲掉一部分的。
一段感情如果总是需要一方去委屈求全，割舍掉自己最骄傲的那部分，往往会无疾而终。于是这段曾经在冰箱上都贴不下二人甜蜜合照的恋情以失败告终。
在下一关中，主角搬回了自己的家，昔日与前男友的合照也如同放在床底的奖状一样被收纳进柜子。完成这一关的配文是：“小时候总觉得这间房间很大。”，因为她长大了。

当然这个故事最后还是he的，主角喝冰美式之后交往了新的女朋友[spoiler]开玩笑，主角应该是双性恋[/spoiler]，虽然没太看懂两个人相知相识的过程是怎么样的，但家里的装潢很有生活气息，主角的时尚小垃圾和奖状终于又可以放在显眼的地方了。两个人不知道是试管还是领养了小孩，有一间房间是婴儿房。
完成最后一关出现的cg不再是房间照片，而是——[i][b]她抱着吉他，爱人笑着抱着牙牙学语的小孩子，两个人一起坐在院子里看夕阳下的余晖。[/b][/i]
[h2]生活怎么可能跟谁过都是一样呢？[/h2]
谢谢这个小体量游戏两小时给我带来的放松与温暖。[spoiler]也祝耐心看完这条评测的你生活愉快[/spoiler]

个人认为是市面上最好玩的收纳整理，非常需要续作或者dlc！！自己房间都一团乱的人在游戏里一口气整理了好几个小时，很上头。
玩法就是把各种物品放到他们该在的房间、该在的位置上。物品的摆放位置并不是绝对的，可以有一点点操作空间。比如书架上的书可以整整齐齐地按高度种类摆好，也可以乱堆一气总之在书架上就行。
拆开一箱箱物品的过程同时也是拆开主角故事的过程，从物品的变化得知生活的种种细节是一种很奇妙的体验。
像素画风看着很舒服，不过相应的问题是一些小物件让人看不出是什么，而且也没有任何形式的提示；可能是文化差异一些大的物品我也不知道是什么…如果能显示物品名字就太好了。

Joguinho muito amável, me estressou em alguns momentos porque eu não sabia o que eram os objetos e ficava um tempão colocando em tudo que era canto até descobrir (ou nem descobrir, só aceitar que deu certo e eh isto) mas em um geral é bem amorzinho, ótimo pra quem gosta de organização.

4小时不到，一共八关。

游戏的时间从童年到结婚生子，从自己的一间小窝到整个别墅的布局。平淡悠长的人生缩影。

纯粹的点击游戏，如果用手柄的话，会相对减轻右手食指的压力，如果在放上一部电影或者电视剧边玩边看的话，还是比较惬意的。单玩游戏难免会有点单调和烦躁。
Really fun little puzzle game about unpacking things dahh its very relaxing, i really enjoyed it
очень атмосферная игра веет вайбом доброй и здоровой семьи очень хорошее качество и детали супер советую всем!! (мне 11 лет)

short game length (w it only taking roughly 5.5 hrs for me to complete), but really cute and cozy! such a satisfying game to just relax and mentally regroup with <3

(wishing i had as many books as p. lmao)
absolutely amazing game and please make a new story line if you can!!!!! i think about this game every single day and i fucking enjoyed it to my full capacity.

Jogar Unpacking foi uma experiência bem interessante, seu grande objetivo no jogo é arrumar os comodos da casa com os objetos empacotados (motivo do nome do jogo hehe), seguindo uma pequena historia contada através dos diarios que voce contrói concluindo a arrumação da casa.

Ao mesmo tempo que o jogo consegue te acalmar e ajudar, ele pode te deixar um pouco triste por nao saber onde certos itens podem ficar.

Sobre pontos negativos e positivos, não achei nenhum ponto negativo nele, ele ajuda voce a pode se organizar melhor e ajuda a acalmar em muitos momentos, acho que pode não ser um jogo que todo mundo vá gostar, mas se você estiver pensando em comprar, recomendo de verdade

It is a fun game. It is a puzzle game that has flexible answers. The only downside is that it only takes around 5 hours to complete. I wish there were more levels. You can start a new album, but it is a repeat of the previous album. It is really fun for what it is.

kind of expensive for a game that can be finished fairly quickly, thoroughly enjoyed the storyline and the game in general. some confusing parts but other than that it was really calming and addicting.

This was such a lovely little cozy game with a unique storytelling approach. As someone who has moved several times in their life and lived with roommates, the story really resonated with me. Specifically, seeing some random (unclickable, therefore someone else's) objects in the [spoiler]roommate stage becoming clickable unpackable items in the next stage[/spoiler]. This was so common with myself and my friends who also lived with roommates; [spoiler]collecting things left behind to add to your sparse stash of home items.[/spoiler] I also appreciated after the [spoiler]MC moved back home as an adult then moved back into her own place, she brought a few more items from her childhood bedroom with her.[/spoiler]

I appreciated the (relative) freedom to place items as it made replays enjoyable. The only thing I would suggest as a QOL thing is an option to see a little description window of what the item is (like if you press SHIFT or CTRL while holding an item it will tell you what it is). There were a couple of items I was unsure of and it made placing them a bit confusing (like the louffa - I legitimately thought it was a ball of yarn and couldn't understand why I couldn't put it in the livingroom lol).

I would love to see (and would happily pay for) more stories to play through. I think this is such an empathetic, emotional yet still lighthearted way of sharing someone's life.
nice to turn your brain off and just play something chill and relaxing

I love this game, it's incredibly cozy and relaxing. The game play is intuitive, the sound effects are satisfying, and the whole unpacking process is enjoyable (unlike real life). I only wish it was longer and had more levels/items to go through. I've replayed it several times over the years, although it does get repetitive after a while.
It was pretty fun...I beat it super quick but getting all the achievements were a good way to get a first game with a 100%. It was alright :)

不喜欢整理东西的话不要买，嗯。
其实做了很多很有意思的互动，这种间接叙事也非常的不错，虽然游戏几乎没有什么文本，但是通过物品的摆放也传递了很多信息，这一点做的很好。但是有一些东西实在有点看不出来是用来干什么的，所以也不知道该摆在哪里，可能这个玩家很容易和游戏脱节的一部分。
Cute cozy game. Struggled with some of the really specific item placement, so I turned off the puzzle mode which made it more enjoyable.

This is such a beautiful game, it needs more popularity. For people who like organising, or even if you don't, the style is cute and the music in the background makes it all the more better. It has such a good story-line with such a wholesome ending, very well made. Also I experienced zero bugs when playing so they did an awesome job with that. Anyone and everyone should play Unpacking, 10/10 game in my opinion.

I really like games with an unpacking or decorating mechanic and this one is a great example of both. You decorate the MC's homes throughout her life and slowly learn about her life story. It was fun following every step of her life through the items she owned. I glad she found her happy ending in the end.

The pixel graphic style is cute, and the sounds are pleasant.  In addition, I enjoy the cozy, self-paced gaming experience, especially when there are no time limits or point systems that put me under pressure.  I, overall, like the aspect of sorting the items at my own leisure.

And I got this game as a gift from a friend :)
um jogo MUITO bom! além de ser super relaxante e fazer passar o tempo, ele ainda conta uma história sem ao menos usar palavras. ainda to no inicio mas já recomendo muito!

The idea of an organizing game that also tells a story through the choice of items and the areas is really compelling.
As someone who has moved a number of times in her life, you can tell a lot from a person by the items, how many items, what kind of items, whether it's old or new stuff, etc. And the creators did a great job showing the story through this.
Thank you!
i played this once by myself and once with my girlfriend and it's just one of those games to get lost in. finally 100%'d all achievements today and just had a great time doing so. very relaxed vibes.

Ya ben bu oyunu duygusal olarak kötü bir zamanda oynadım ve beni bu kadar etkiledi ya da gerçekten güzel bir oyun. Aslını isterseniz gerçekten güzel bir oyun, karakter hakkındaki gelişmeleri sadece taşındığı zamanlarda öğreniyoruz ve ben gerçekten sevmiştim. Birinin hayatını bu açıdan yorumlamamıştım hiç.

Such a cute & relaxing game. You just unpack boxes as the main character moves throughout life. The backstory ends up being super cute. The stickers & achievements are also fun to get as they're just little quirks the devs added into the game to make it feel more real. This game is a really nice change of pace from other games, and there's no time limit. Definitely recommend if you want a cozy game.
If you love a cozy games where you put away stuff with a bit of lore. It's a good game to play and get comfy with.
A very sweet game about life and change. Absolutely relaxed and enjoyable gameplay for those looking for a nice, cozy time.

one of the best games i've ever played. my joy for organising gets everything in this + the sounds are so satisfying. the story also draws you in do deeply!! i find myself being pissed at her ex bf the entire level, and feeling so much joy when i see she's a lesbian and having a baby with her wife !! 

basically, 10/10 game and i'd love to see it get a sequel or add on levels
远超预期的一款游戏......今天刚刚全成就通关了，最后的音乐非常好听cg也很萌。游戏细节非常丰富而且隐藏在流程中的剧情也很有意思，在游玩过程中会逐渐感觉和女主变得熟悉起来，女主每次搬家以后在行李箱子里找到之前的小摆件真的很高兴，可以感觉到女主是非常有意思的性格UU 而且老实说13年以后的剧情简直是我梦想中的生活......有这样可以自由而且正当地画画的空间、还能学画画真是幸福啊......
i have played this 5 times. i will keep on replaying for the rest of my life. it is the most relaxing satisfying game in existence.
É um jogo bastante relaxante, com boas músicas e uma história emocionante por trás. Embora o jogo seja bom, recomendo aguardar uma promoção.

🎮✨ UNPACKING: DESEMPACA MEMORIAS PROFUNDAMENTE HUMANAS Y EMOCIONALES 📦💭🧳

Unpacking no es solo un videojuego… es una experiencia silenciosa que te abraza sin decir una sola palabra. 🌈💫
A través de 8 mudanzas, desempacas cajas, recuerdos y pedacitos de vida 🏠📦, acompañando a una mujer desde su infancia hasta su adultez, conociéndola sin verla jamás, solo a través de las cosas que elige conservar.

Cada mudanza es un nuevo capítulo: su habitación de niña 🧸, la universidad 🎓, su primer departamento 🪞, una relación con un chico que no funciona 💔, el regreso al hogar familiar 🏡 y finalmente… una nueva vida junto a una mujer con quien por fin encuentra el amor, un hogar y tiene a su primer bebé. ❤️

No es un título para todos 🎨🧠. Su ritmo pausado y su arte pixel art lo convierten en un refugio para quienes buscan calma, nostalgia y sentido, más que adrenalina o competencia. 🌙☕

Es el juego perfecto para esas noches tranquilas donde lo único que quieres es relajarte, escuchar su delicada música 🎶💤 y dejarte llevar por la historia que se esconde entre cada objeto; aunque a veces no sé si esta mujer tiene más mudanzas vs ropa interior, hahaha.

Unpaking es una historia sobre crecer, amar, dejar ir… y re-descubrir quién eres a través de lo que guardas. ✨

Played this game about 3 years ago on the macbook of a friend when we were actually supposed to learn math. Never actually finished playing it. Decided to buy it not too long ago and it was still as enjoyable as back then, even if not used for procrastination. Definitely a cozy game to try!

Very cute short game with an adorable story to uncover! I hope there is a sequel that continues to follow this family - or even another one - to continue the relaxing game play. If not. there is still plenty to enjoy here. I recommend it to anyone who likes these kind of relaxing organization games.

I love this game soo much! Calms my ADHD and eases any anxiety. Not sure when it was made, but the only downside is not knowing what some of the items are because the graphics on them aren't as clear. This issue isn't big enough to disrupt the game play itself, but a newer version with sharper graphics would be amazing!
One of the best cozy games i've ever played. I loved discovering the story myself throughout the game :D
Cute little placer game to play. Fun little story to go with it!

像是陪着她一起度过半生，每翻过一页都有种来到人生新阶段的淡淡惆怅，最后一页她一定感到很幸福，作为旁观者的我也是。
好玩是好玩，但是不耐玩，两三个小时就打通关了。换一本书还以为是其他的关卡没想到也是一样的。
A bit short but I enjoyed it and appreciated the story that it told along the way.
7/10. You unpack your life in different places. Would be nice if there were different stories to unpack. I disliked not being able to place things wherever I wanted to place them.

ボリューム少なめなのでよっぽど気になるのでなければセール待ちがおすすめかも
[spoiler] 恋人？の部屋に引っ越すステージでは相手の部屋は主人公が転がり込んで来るのを想定していなかったような状態で、相手の荷物を勝手に整理し自分のものを無理くり詰めるのが あまり心地よくはなかった[/spoiler]
很细腻的一款游戏，马赛克风格我也很喜欢，很多生活感的小互动，没有平替的游戏体验
super cozy, my comfort game to play even though ive finished it like 4 times. the story is truly so heartwarming and shows the reality of life at times.
I freaking love this game. If it was just cozy and satisfying, that would be one thing. But it also tells a story through just the items you're unpacking. so cool
画面很温馨，跟着一个人的视角度过了十多年，从孩童到读书工作甚至恋爱分手后再结婚生子，每次搬家都有以前的痕迹，照片、玩偶、冰箱贴（这个玩意儿越来越多，后面给我贴不耐烦了哈哈哈），成家后的房子很让人羡慕，有单独衣帽间。所有环节没有时间限制，上头，就是通关比较短，4-5h基本就完全结束了，希望后续还有故事可以玩，我可以给ta整理房间到去世！！！
Short, cute, blast from the past for millennial women (that's a positive).

진짜 재밌음... 개인적으로 도트 그래픽+인테리어 배치 느낌의 게임을 좋아해서인지 취향에 완전 잘 맞고 재밌었음.

같은 물건이어도 놓는 장소마다 내려놓는 소리가 미세하게 달라진다던지 하는 디테일이 마음에 듦.

유일한 단점은 가격 대비 플레이 타임... 도전과제까지 전부 찾아내서 클리어해도 플레이타임이 너무 짧은건 단점으로 느껴짐.

그래도 산걸 후회하지는 않을 정도의 재밌는 게임! 제발 dlc 출시해줬으면 좋겠음...
I absolutely love the graphics and the story line! It is a very relaxing game and the hidden achievements are also pretty fun!
不错，游戏性很好但自由度差点，像素风格很讨喜，就是需要无视一下的lgbt内容，租的大房子来了一堆新的明显是另一个女人的物品，根据剧情我还以为是她妹妹呢，结果后面更抽象两个女的试管或领养个孩子，但鉴于这游戏发售的时候正处于lgbt狂潮，渗透了各行各业甚是游戏，也没办法，所以除了这还挺好的，希望有机会来点续作或dlc
A really good shory game where the whole story is told with only environmental storytelling. Was really nice to play.
Very chill and comfy, perfect to rest after a long day. Love it.
A lovely and relaxing game that makes you feel nostalgic and looking forward to the future at the same time.
A short but cozy game, unpacking is fun, the story cute. and worth it

3.9小时，太短了，拉时长的地方只会是东西没放对，以及要是我没有强迫症需要把书本全排齐估计还能更短时间玩完。
原价买不值。
好的地方:
1. 大多数物品都有四象旋转，还不是直接镜像，是真的四象
2.精致，小东西多，很可爱，很治愈
3.本来以为有剧情对我来讲没什么用，后面还真玩进去有一种欣慰的感觉，像女儿长大了

但是内容真的太少了，一会就玩玩了，卖25~40块还好说

cute game :) simple and calming. it's quite short, but i think that works for this type of game. i was able to get all the achievements, without looking anything up, in under 11 hours. 
there are some missed opportunities with the in-game photo mode, but it was fun to take pictures of the rooms. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a cozy experience; but $20 might be a bit much, definitely wait for a sale.
very cozy game! the soundtrack and sound design are AMAZING and the story you pick up just from arranging house items is so heartfelt and personal. Great game.

its a very cute game for when you want to unwind and solely focus on one thing. but if youre interested in this game, and not great on money right now especially, id recommend buying it whenever its on sale since theres not much gameplay aside from unpacking boxes.

One of the covid-era classics, a charming little puzzle game that's unique in a very good way. It's satisfying to organize your character's different rooms and the small details and storytelling aspects were fun on top.

非常治愈和温馨的搬家、整理小游戏，初见体验感不错，游戏时长约3小时，短小精悍，在玩家差不多开始感觉重复性高、难受之前戛然而止；
游戏一共8幕剧情，除了第1幕教程外，都有多个房间需要布置，在短短几个小时中讲完了女主从成长、恋爱、分手、结婚、生子的一系列过程，也看到了女主的青涩、失望、欢乐等多种感情，最后也是欢乐结局，女主也得到的自己向往的生活，与另一个女生？建立了新的家境，可喜可贺~
随着剧情，需要摆放的东西也越来越多，越来越多的书、玩偶、衣服、盆栽等，倒也很合理，也看到很多东西随着时间的推移越来越旧，就像牙杯最后都有缺口了，不过也有一些缺点，硬性规定某些东西需要放置在特定位置有点说不过去；
关卡完成后，可以生成一个gif或者视频，还原布置的过程，这一点非常好~

I think the game overall was very calming and adorable. The game doesn't hold your hand through the story but each item you unpack adds a detail to the story. As you progress, the way those items move and change also affect the story.
It is a good game to keep you relaxed and curious about what comes next.
The ending made me emotional.

fun and nostalgic game! very cozy and slow-paced play style.

y'a rien de plus détente que se jeu, un réel moment de plaisir avec une histoire touchante raconté a travers les possession matériel de cette personne, j'adore le concepts.

petite mention au chaussettes qui et la chose la plus satisfaisante et frustrante du jeu x)
Cute little game about organizing the different stages of our character's life. Very fun! I loved finding out the story of our main character as we went along :)
I like how relaxing it is but one thing and i dont really dislike anything about it.

Hello Everyone!

After completing "Unpacking," I thought that I would take the time to write a review for this game. Overall, I would rate this game with FOUR STARS. 

Let's start with the positives.
1.} Playability: I did not experience issues throughout any part of the game. I was able to download, play, and finish the game without running into bugs or other issues. It seems that the Creators took extra care to ensure these types of issues would not happen.

2.) Time Allotment: If you are looking for a game that you can finish quickly or leave in the middle of, this might just be your game. It's not a long game, if you are a player that like to complete the game in one sitting. In addition, if you find yourself being a player that has to leave their game often, I find this game to be okay to do that. I did not run into any issues with my game progress not saving.

3.) Overall - Overall, I would say that this game is a light-hearted and colorful game that, for those like myself who like to organize, is just the right game to play if you need a lift. 

Now, the only negative.
1.) Achievements - As someone who prefers to complete ALL Achievements on the games that I play, I found this game, though simple, to have a few achievements that I had to look at the Spoilers for in order to figure them out. When playing the game, you might expect that all of the achievements or organizational related, but this is not the case. I found myself having to think WAY outside the box as far as the types of achievements that were listed. 

Despite the one negative that I found to the game, I would rate this game highly and would recommend it to others.

Really cute game. Love that there was a subtle story going on if you paid enough attention to the items being added and removed. It felt close to reality. I played it mostly in one sitting and enjoyed it, but coming back after a long while, it's still a relaxing way to spend your time. However, I would have loved even more freedom on where you place the items.

Beautiful calm game with lots of little easter eggs hidden. The achievements were really cute and quirky and I love the overall visuals and music for this game. 

I've played this game on both the switch and the PC and it is a game I come back to when I feel like I need to unwind or need to recharge with some wholesome vibes. 

Really hope the team release more games in future or update more levels.

I absolutely loved this game and was sad it was so short lived and ended fairly quickly. 

If you’re someone who LOVES to keep things organised and neat, this is going to satisfy that part of you.

一直在蹲新史低没蹲到，但是平史低35也超值啊！！！第一关最后所有的物品都摆放妥当了，只剩一个精美的笔记本哪里都放不了，最后发现可以放在枕头底下时这游戏在这一刻已经回本了！细节真的超级丰富，陪伴始终的小猪玩偶、中途加入的小老虎、逐渐增加的小鸡公仔，之前是灰模后来涂装上色的吟游诗人模型，越来越多的旅游纪念品，破了口的紫色杯子当作刷牙的口杯继续用，穿了很多年的D20骰子T恤，还有数量众多但完全没有重复的书籍、光盘、卡带。对我来说最惊喜的地方是作者做了非常细致的声效，印象最深的是几盒桌游，两三盒是《卡坦岛》那种晃起来哗啦哗啦的里面杂七杂八的token很多，另一个小盒看起来是纯棋类游戏，晃起来就只有木制棋子的碰撞声，而且不同物品放在纺织品、金属和硬质木板表面的音效都做了差异性设计

Petit jeu mignon comme tout et qui a bien comblé mon plaisir coupable du rangement ! J'ai beaucoup aimé le concept, voir l'évolution d'une vie à travers les lieux et les objets du quotidien, sans jamais un mot de description. C'est très fort et très prenant !
A very chill game with an extremely sweet and surprising story that slowly reveals itself place by place.
actually super fun, and really creative way to tell a story. cozy game, little replayability in there too because its fun organizing things and getting every little sticker.

Es un juego bastante bonito para tomarte el tiempo de poner música de fondo y decorar; tiene un poco de puzzles, pero si solamente quieres estar un rato organizando mientras escuchas algo de música o el propio soundtrack del juego. Lo recibí por mi cumple, realmente un muy buen juego, el cual no esperé ver que tenía una historia de transfondo; mientras más organizas y prestas atención a los mini puzzles, cada objeto y piezas que están en cada caja, incluso el cómo estas están organizadas, es realmente espectacular que me quedaba momentos procesando algunas cosas, las cuales parecían tener algún significado más profundo que solo una decoración más, la cual poner en un sitio.

Al igual que quien parece ser la protagonista, este juego se quedará como una pequeña pieza que recordaré con cariño en mi kokoro. <3
神秘增压游戏，玩到后面房间多了越来越增压，解压瞬间只在摆完终于能退出的时候

A very bittersweet cozy game with some replayability. You learn a lot about the character you're playing as through their stuff, which allows for some interesting personal reflection about consumption and our identification with material items. When stressed, I find myself coming back to this game on occasion to take some time to relax. I would recommend this game for people who enjoy slower-paced games and like to see things neat and organized.
Super cozy and a great story line so you get attached to the items that you are unpacking! Highly recommend!
Un juego muy bonito a nivel visual y la manera que han fusionado la narrativa con la jugabilidad me encanta me encanta, qué penita que sea tan corta, pero lo querré rejugar seguramente

很深刻温情的小故事
朋友说它是“一场无声的人生叙事，一次心灵的整理仪式。”
如果喜欢整理行李时的那份宁静，或是在布置房间时感到过满足，一定要试试这个游戏。它没有分数和时间限制，也没有失败，只有一个又一个装满回忆的箱子，和一间间等待被赋予“家”的意义的空房间。游戏过程中能感觉到玩家不仅是整理师，也是无声的见证者，通过空间和物品的变化，拼凑出一个完整而动人的成长故事。
非常适合玩几个小时来从快节奏生活中抽离，每次打开一个新的存档，都像是和老朋友重逢一样温暖。

ぼーっとポチポチ進められて楽しい

The sounds are so perfect! The colors are soft and charming and the story is told naturally in such a clever way I won't spoil it! The art is so charming and the gameplay itself is clever and calming. I cannot resist the charm of playing such a wonderful game! If you find yourself in need of something to unwind or focus on something else for just a little while, unpacking is one of the best options there is!

Bom jogo, é curto mas o storytelling é muito massa, você vai descobrindo sobre a vida da protagonista só com os objetos que ela leva para cada mudança de casa. 
No geral, o jogo é muito bem feito e dá para ver que foi colocado muito carinho no projeto. Minha única crítica é que o preço é muito elevado para a simplicidade do jogo, mas talvez isso seja um problema com questão de preço local e não com o jogo em si.

很喜欢这个游戏，在飞机上打到没耐心，整理完在新家的一切东西，又在游戏里也慢慢整理好了新的生活。
主角小时候的玩具在每一幕都出现，能够看到她生活留下的痕迹。一些东西从前跟着她走过自己的来时路，她未来也依旧需要这些东西的陪伴。
Fun and relaxing game to play though I wish it was longer. But I love how you can replay or have different saves for all your friends.

The concept of this game is a perfect expression of "cozy gaming." I fully enjoyed it ... what there is of it. I think I paid $30 ish dollars for it - my bad. Several Redditors recommended it, and the basic review stats were great, so ... I was desperate to dissociate? 

At any rate - DON'T BY AT FULL PRICE.  I took my time with the game, and am basically done at 19 hours. I'm doing the dark star mode right now, but then, in someone's great words, "That's all, she wrote."

Is it fun? Yup. A little repetitive, but hey - COZY. 

Is it a good value, $/hour of play? Unfortunately, nope.
非常烦躁，很讨厌每次拆完所有箱子之后的红框，提醒我这个不能放在这里，那个不能放在那里，真的很冒犯很不礼貌，有没有可能我就是想让玩偶坐在椅子上？不把物品放在“规定”的地方仿佛触犯天条一样，一个个试过去终于摆在了“正确”的位置，再迎接一个欢天喜地的关于搬家的小日记，并不感到喜悦，感觉我是一款摄像头型搬家工人，不能自主决定任何事。
流程比较短但是很治愈，就是玩着玩着可能会感到无聊，以及要是关卡再多一点就好了...

Unpacking bir perspektif düzenleme oyunu.. Kutudan çıkan eşyaları sırasıyla diziyorsunuz. Kafa dağıtmak için mükemmel..
Basitliğini bi kenara bırakırsak ben derin anlamlar yükledim çünkü bence yaşadığımız herşeyin eşyalarımızla bir bağı bir hatırası var... Bana çok güzel şeyler hatırlattı. Yaratıcılarına teşekkürler. Ponçik bir kalbiniz varsa oynayın derim. <3
Glad I got this game on a massive offer, I would not pay full price for it. Need more stories.

Unpacking é uma obra-prima minimalista que transforma uma tarefa simples, desempacotar caixas e organizar objetos em uma experiência emocional profunda e significativa.
O jogo prova que não é preciso diálogos nem textos para contar uma boa história. Cada item que o jogador tira da caixa carrega memórias, fases da vida e mudanças internas da personagem principal. Ao organizar os objetos em cada novo ambiente, o jogador também reconstrói a história de alguém, percebendo conquistas, decepções e recomeços de forma sutil e tocante. 
Simplesmente amei

Everyone and their mom has reviewed [b]Unpacking[/b] at this point, so I'mma skip the usual format and talk about my experience.

You see, the first time I tried [b]Unpacking[/b], I quit within 12 minutes.  You unpack boxes one item at a time, intuit where those items are supposed to go, right-click stuff to score achievements, and that's it; that's the entire game.

Fast-forward a few years: folks were still gushing over it at every opportunity, but I still couldn't vibe with it.  Then some random redditor wrote how sad they were about the boyfriend's apartment because he hadn't made space for her.  

That stuck with me.  For months.

The third time I played [b]Unpacking[/b], I approached it like a story rather than an organizing or decorating game.  I took stock of this little girl's bedroom and saw a burgeoning artist, steeped in nerdom, not dissimilar from me in '97.  She takes her favorite things and art supplies and mismatched box of hand-me-down kitchenware to college (why did every other student have that red grillpress in the 2000s?), where she makes friends who don't do dishes and embark on a life-changing D&D campaign.  Her trajectory from there is… so relatable.  

This time, I get it.  [b]Unpacking[/b] has nothing to do with making pretty rooms or feeling zen; it's a detail puzzle about fitting your life into new spaces as you age, making space for others, and what matters enough to hold onto.  It's also a heartwarming story about an artsy girl with big dreams.  

I'm not a sentimental or keepsake-y person, and she'll need a professional to fix the ruin I made of her last closet, but I had [i]a lot[/i] of feelings about her life.  I've never been so proud of a fictional character for owning nice dishes. 

That said, gameplay mechanics are weak (see paragraph 2), I could only play for an hour at a time before losing interest (which actually helped the game breathe like a nice wine), and the game is short.  I personally wouldn't drop $20 USD on this, but definitely got my ROI at the 55% discount.  If you and your mom haven't played yet and like anything I've said here, then pick this up next time it goes on sale.

【我写完才发现，这不是一个测评，完全是自己游戏中的感触，写在这里以作记录。】

作为一个重度囤囤鼠症患者，以及一个越来越不想离开舒适圈的人，玩这个游戏的时候总感觉自己有点精神紧绷。

因为清楚地知道，每次packing的时候都要断舍离一些东西，而这对一个囤囤鼠症患者简直是折磨。同时这也几乎意味着，马上要离开一个已经呆舒服了的地方，而到了unpacking的时候，又要添置一些新东西，又是要去艰难地去适应一个新的地方的过程了。

游戏里的有些场景和我自己的经历高度重合，在一个人住的小单间的场景，游戏中厨房的家具布局，几乎和自己住过的地方一模一样。于是东西的布置我也几乎都完全按照自己当时住的时候一样摆放。一模一样的水槽，一模一样的洗碗海绵，游戏中每次放出一个东西，好像都会牵出自己真实生活中一点快要遗忘的记忆。会想起自己一个人在异国他乡，去超市里挑选每一个锅碗瓢盆，又带到住处把他们放进柜子里的种种经历。

而自己现在好像有点抗拒这个回忆的过程。我看到游戏中箱子里，一次又一次拿出一个红色的玩具小车，就好像是自己的倒影，总想携带着一些过去的印子去到新的地方。我还有没有结束这个游戏，不知道这个红色的玩具小车最终会不会一直留下，就像我也不知道自己能不能一直带着一些过去的印子，去到以后新的地方。

跟女朋友打趣说过，家里以后要不要放一个杂物间，女朋友说照你这个性子是一定要有的，但是她要趁我不在的时候，把没用的东西通通丢掉。哈哈哈，我说可不行，这样我就要碎开来了。

这好像游戏里有的粉色存钱罐小猪，我总觉得这个物件储存的性质和经常出现的碎开来的结局很矛盾，存下来的东西就要好好保存不是么，为什么很多时候看到的是要打碎它呢？

为什么总想带着一些过去的印子来到新的地方呢？我想不明白，但是舍不得。

明天是假期的最后一天，又要离开家了。到了明年，又要去到一个崭新的地方了。生活里真是有好多好多个packing和unpacking的时刻哇！

Things I wish I knew before I bought this game:

1. This isn't just a game where you unpack boxes, you're also unpacking the story of the main character. That was a nice surprise; the story is very relatable. 
2. You can finish this game in 4 hours. Because of this, I feel like the OG price of $20 is too much. I bought it on sale for $10 and that still felt a bit high for what you get. 
3. This isn't just a cozy game where you can place things willy nilly. Imagine my Mexican shock when I realized I couldn't put my pots and pans in the oven to store them. I do like that aspect because it makes the game more challenging and fun.
4. You only get three saves. Perhaps you can overwrite your old play through, if you want, though. 
5. There is some replayability to this because you can try to unpack things differently in your next play through. I just don't think I want to revisit this game more than a couple of times since it can get repetitive. 

I do like this game, enough so that I struggled to rate this a thumbs down. But once I found myself telling my coworker not to buy this game, I knew what I had to do.

Unpacking es uno de esos juegos que parecen simples a primera vista, pero terminan sorprendiéndote. Me gustó mucho cómo logra contar una historia sin usar texto ni diálogos: solo con los objetos que vas desempacando y ordenando, conoces al personaje, ves cómo crece, cómo cambia de lugar y cómo algunas cosas la acompañan toda la vida mientras otras se quedan atrás. Es una forma muy sutil y diferente de narrar una historia.

La jugabilidad es relajante y casi terapéutica. Ideal si buscas algo tranquilo para desconectar un rato. Además, el platino se obtiene de manera bastante natural mientras juegas, lo que lo hace perfecto si quieres completar un 100% fácil y sin frustraciones.

No es un juego largo ni que busque impresionar, pero sí una experiencia muy agradable y bien lograda. Lo recomiendo si buscas algo relajante o una forma diferente y creativa de vivir una historia.

Unpacking est un jeu que l'on peut qualifier de tranquille, presque méditatif, où l’on déballe des cartons pièce par pièce, mais surtout, souvenir par souvenir.
Sans un mot, il raconte la vie d’une protagoniste à laquelle il sera facile pour chacun de s’identifier, et à travers elle, c’est un peu notre propre histoire qu’on redécouvre.
Unpacking respire la douceur, la sincérité, et la capacité à dire beaucoup avec très peu. Certes, le jeu est court (comptez entre 2 et 5 heures), mais en peu de temps, il nous fait nous sentir bien, nous sentir « chez soi ».
L'émotion transmise est pure, et c'est tout ce qui compte.

I've moved way too many times in my life. So what was the hype about for a game where all you do is unpack...?

Well, I finally got around to playing it... It's a lot of fun... Maybe fun is not the right word... It's calming and it's like solving a puzzle. Everything needs a place and the satisfaction comes from finishing it. I love all the subtle story telling, it was easy to pick up on and it reminded me about the times I moved in similar situations in my life, whether they were hopeful moves or stressful.

If only actually unpacking during a move was as easy as clicking a mouse.

Anyways, this cozy game is a great experience that can be completed easily in one sitting. If it's on sale, it's definitely worth taking a look at :)

I started the game for the promise of a quick cozy "zen" experience. But I got pretty much nothing like that. Instead I was annoyed when the game's protagonist still hasn't learned the art of not mixing up items when packing. They also never learned to reduce the number of objects they store. 

And while these represent standard real life issues, some other game elements do not. Like the laundry basket only being allowed on the bathroom's floor in one specific location. Before I finally got there, I tried so many other options, in so many rooms. So much fun, really.

Another unrealistic challenge is how poorly many items are designed in game. I often couldn't tell what an object is supposed to represent. 
Is that white stuff a cutting board, a bathroom scale, a kitchen scale or something entirely different? I still have no idea. 
And if you can't tell what something is, you randomly must guess where it's supposed to be stored. 

So sorry, I really can't claim that this game granted me a relaxing experience at any time. Instead I just got a lasting mild annoyance. 
What remains is all the relocation telling a life story. Which is nice. But not nice enough.

I'll be blunt, the price point for that game is simply outrageous. 20€ is way way too high, and even on sale at -50%, it's still too expensive. I would value it around 5-7€ max.

For 20€, you're close to Stray, Outer Wilds and a lot of other quality indie game that have waaaaaaay more content and effort put into it.

Just to be clear, I'm not complaining because the game is short (around 2h). I would totally pay that for a great quality game even if it's short and have zero replayability (and I did for Firewatch, Stray, What Remains of Edith Finch...), but that game is not worth that price point.

It has a nice story telling, but nothing groundbreaking (there's literally a single "twist" or two). The music and art are nice, and it's a pleasant game, but again, at 5-7€, not 3-4 times more.

This game is okay. But there are two things about it that I find frustrating.
 1) Due to it being pixel art, occasionally you can’t tell what something is, and it complains that the object isn’t in a valid location, and of course you have no idea where it goes. So you have to place it in random spots until the game is happy with the placement. I don’t find that fun or relaxing.
 2) The lack of precision for item placement. Everything goes on an invisible grid. And sometimes that leads to frustrating things like:  Cookie sheets cannot be stored on their side, and the only thing you can stack on them are other cookie sheets. Or a pot with its handle, the handle sticking out in a way that takes up a huge portion of the shelf. You can’t turn it slightly so it takes less space. No, it must waste a huge amount of space. There are little frustrating things like that all through out the game.

So while overall it was interesting, and I like how it kind of tells a story without directly telling a story. But the little frustrations stop me from being able to recommend this.

Why doesn't Steam have a [b]Mixed[/b] review? Anyway, the game is warm and relaxing. I really like it, but it’s a bit too short for me. I finished the whole game in just 4 hours. 
Another thing, can the items have a label to tell players what they are?? Maybe it’s just me not knowing enough common sense or because of cultural differences, but there are some items where I have no idea what they’re for or where they should go. I just practice my English by looking up item names in the game.
Also, making everything stay in a fixed spot feels a bit too strict...? Like, sometimes the yoga mat should go under the bed, and other times around it. That seems kind of unreasonable to me, since everyone has different habits and ways of organizing things. I think we should respect that.

Unpacking è uno di quei giochi che ti conquista senza bisogno di grandi effetti speciali. Si presenta come un’esperienza cozy e rilassante, in cui l’obiettivo è semplice ma estremamente coinvolgente: spacchettare scatoloni e sistemare gli oggetti nei diversi ambienti della protagonista.

La particolarità sta nel fatto che ogni stanza e ogni oggetto raccontano, senza parole, una fase importante della vita della protagonista. Attraverso libri, vestiti, fotografie e piccoli dettagli, il giocatore ricostruisce la sua storia, seguendo il filo delle tappe più significative.

L’ambientazione è tenera e curata in ogni minimo particolare: la grafica 3D, colorata e stilizzata, trasmette calore e intimità, trasformando ogni livello in una piccola finestra sulla quotidianità. Non c’è fretta né competizione: il ritmo lento e meditativo permette di rilassarsi e allo stesso tempo riflettere sul significato che gli oggetti assumono nelle nostre vite.

------
Unpacking is one of those games that wins you over without the need for flashy effects. It presents itself as a cozy and relaxing experience, where the goal is simple yet deeply engaging: unpack boxes and place the items in the protagonist’s different living spaces.

What makes it special is that every room and every object silently tells a part of the protagonist’s life story. Through books, clothes, photographs, and small details, the player gradually pieces together her journey, following the milestones that shaped her life.

The atmosphere is tender and carefully crafted: the colorful, stylized 3D graphics convey warmth and intimacy, turning each level into a small window into everyday life. There’s no rush, no competition—just a slow, meditative pace that allows you to relax while reflecting on the meaning that objects carry in our lives.

„Unpacking“ ist der Beweis, dass man keine Explosionen, Kämpfe oder Dialoge braucht, um eine tiefgehende Geschichte zu erzählen. Das Spiel wirkt auf den ersten Blick simpel – man packt Umzugskartons aus und räumt Dinge in eine neue Wohnung ein. Doch in dieser Schlichtheit entfaltet sich eine unerwartet emotionale, intime und wunderschön erzählte Geschichte.

Ohne ein einziges gesprochenes Wort oder Text erzählt Unpacking das Leben einer Person über verschiedene Lebensabschnitte hinweg – vom Kinderzimmer über die erste Studentenwohnung bis hin zum eigenen Zuhause. Jeder Gegenstand, den man aus den Kisten holt, erzählt ein Stück Biografie: Erinnerungen, Erfolge, Rückschläge, Beziehungen, Neubeginne.
So wird das Aufräumen zu einem Puzzle der Persönlichkeit – meditativ, beruhigend und zugleich erstaunlich tief.

Der Pixel-Art-Stil ist liebevoll bis ins Detail gestaltet, die Soundkulisse ist sanft und realistisch – vom Rascheln des Packpapiers bis zum Klick der Schublade. Dieses Spiel schafft es, dass man beim Platzieren einer Zahnbürste oder eines Fotos plötzlich innehalten und lächeln (oder seufzen) muss.

Fazit:
Unpacking ist eine stille Meisterleistung, die zeigt, dass große Emotionen auch in den kleinsten Dingen liegen können. Es ist gleichzeitig entspannend, nachdenklich und zutiefst menschlich – ein Spiel, das nicht laut sein muss, um Eindruck zu hinterlassen.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)

玩游戏的时候刚换了生活环境，搬进了没有家具的小房子里，玩这游戏好像再重新和室友一起再把自己家布置了一次。现实中路过商店都会注意能不能给自己的小家添点什么，在这里又体验了一次这种逐渐充实自己的空间的感觉，而且比现实更好的地方在于添置东西的时候不用想着到时候如何收拾和断舍离。跟着女主对各个阶段属于自己空间的布置，也能感受到女主的生活故事，从小时候有自己的房间，到开启大学生活，再搬进男友家，遭受一些挫折，再回到自己的小房间，最后又搬出去，找到自己的新伴侣，各种细枝末节讲出了一个细致的故事。例如能看出女主从小喜欢艺术，她在与前男友关系并不太健康委曲求全，哪怕搬出去那么久后家里的房间永远为她准备着的家人的爱。还有她的新生活，她的女友喜欢植物，与她兴趣相投，她们的相处的舒适和温馨。是一种在收拾物品中逐渐跟随主角一起长大的感觉，蛮有新意的。就是流程太短，原价买确实是贵了，以及我很多时候真的不知道那个物品到底是什么...只能一个房间和地方穷举试到底应该放哪里，跟着攻略放完了都不知道那到底是什么...如果有文字标注物品名称会更好理解。

This game has a lot of restrictions that can be incredibly frustrating. You'll spend time unpacking and decorating the rooms, making them look just the way you want. Some things go in the drawers, other things go on the shelves... great, it's time to move to the next level. But hold on - why can't you put a potted plant on the shelf you want? Why can't shoes go in the closet? You can't advance! Then you'll spend more time trying to figure out where the game "thinks" these items should go, rearranging everything that you just placed, and ultimately coming away with a cluttered mess. Why...
